prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the base of the prism Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, 0 and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.15). Create the first face of the sketch with a loop consisting of the following: * A line from (0, 0.375) to (0.375, 0.0). * A line from (0.375, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). * A line from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.75). * A line from (0.75, 0.75) to (0.0, 0.75). * A line from (0.0, 0.75) to (0.0, 0.375). Note that the loop consists of 5 lines and the shape is a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. Part 2: Creating the first extrusion Create an extrusion with an extrude depth towards the normal of 0 and an extrude depth opposite normal of 0.15. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. The resulting shape is a rectangular prism with dimensions of approximately 0.71 by 0.71 by 0.03 units. Part 3: Creating the second extrusion Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, 0 and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.18). Create the first face of the sketch with a loop consisting of the following: * A line from (0, 0) to (0.372, 0). * An arc from (0.372, 0) to (0, 0.372) with a midpoint at (0.263, 0.263). * A line from (0, 0.372) to (0, 0). Note that the loop consists of 3 curves and the shape is a cylindrical hole. Part 4: Creating the final shape Create an extrusion with an extrude depth towards the normal of 0.15 and an extrude depth opposite normal of 0. Set the sketch scale to 0.372. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the vertical axis of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 0.37 by 0.37 by 0.15 units. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of approximately 0.25 units.</description>

Step 4: Extrude the 2D Sketch to Generate the 3D Model Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.0625 and in the opposite direction by a depth of 0.0625. The final shape of this part is a rectangular prism with rounded corners and edges, with four holes along its length, evenly spaced. The dimensions are 0.75 units in length, width, and height.</description>
